column4: anyone know what the command is to build a new kernel and detect running modules and place that in .config
the command was introduced with kernel 2.6
lsmod will show you the modules loaded
it detects and makes a .config file for building new kernel
i been for hours scratching my head googaling it even make help
dunno why its not in make help
what annoys me about linux they sometimes miss certain details
agreed. usually they are really good with details though :)
atleast  libc man pages are awesome :)
